Install on windows Bash
-----------------------

1- Download and default install Node.Js
2- Open Windows bash and type: sudo apt-get install -y nodejs. (which npm should give sth like /usr/bin/npm)
3- sudo npm install -g gulp
3- sudo npm install -g bower
4- Go to the project folder cd my_project/ and do gulp init (only the first time)
   (Gulp needs 2 files at the root: gulpfile.js, package.json)
5- Do npm install fom npm to install the dependencies listed in package.json in 'devDependencies'
6- to use css autoprefixer you may need to add 'require('es6-promise').polyfill();' at the beginning of the gulpfile


Get a Gulp project running from Github
--------------------------------------

- Git clone
- npm install (install deps from package.json)
- gulp


Start a new Gulp project
------------------------

- npm install --save-dev gulp gulp-autoprefixer gulp-bower gulp-cssbeautify gulp-csso gulp-include gulp-load gulp-rename gulp-replace gulp-sass gulp-uglify
- Update a few packages if you get errors... e.g. npm update browser-sync
- if you have 'ReferenceError: Promise is not defined' from autoprefixer module, add 'require('es6-promise').polyfill();' at the beginning of gulpfile.
